clinical_study.brief_title: Recurrence Rate of Mini-SLET vs. Limbal-Conjunctival Autograft in Primary Pterygium Excision
clinical_study.official_title: Recurrence Rate of Mini-SLET (Simple Limbal Epithelial Transplantation) vs. Limbal-Conjunctival Autograft in Primary Pterygium Excision

lead_sponsor.agency: Instituto de Oftalmología Fundación Conde de Valenciana

clinical_study.source: Instituto de Oftalmología Fundación Conde de Valenciana

brief_summary.textblock: To study the efficacy and safety of amniotic membrane transplantation as an adjunctive therapy after surgical excision of primary pterygium and compare the clinical outcomes with conjunctival autograft

detailed_description.textblock:
Prospective Randomized Blind Clinical Trial
Sixty-four eyes of 64 patients with primary nasal pterygium have been operated by two surgeons (E. G-H, A. N-C). All patients are randomized to undergo Mini-SLET or limbal-conjunctival autograft transplantation as an adjuvant therapy after pterygium excision.
Four eyes were treated with Mini-SLET(group 1), and 26 eyes have been operated with conjunctival autograft (group 2). Patients will be followed up at 1 day, 1 week, 1, 3, 6, 9 and 12 months postoperation. The main outcome measurement was a recurrence rate after surgery.

intervention.description: Pterygium excision is the first step for repair

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with primary nasal pterygium > 2mm
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant
- Previous ocular surgery
